sentence: U.S. market indexes were lower on Thursday.
For the day, the Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 20919.42 for a loss of -23.69 points or -0.11%.
The S&P 500 closed at 2394.44 for a loss of -5.19 points or -0.22%.
The Nasdaq Composite closed at 6115.96 for a loss of -13.18 points or -0.22%.
The VIX Volatility Index was higher for the day at 10.59 for a gain of 0.38 points or 3.72%.
Disappointing retail stock earnings weighed on valuations for the day.

Economic reports affecting trading included the following:
• Jobless claims decreased by 2,000 for the week to 236,000.
• The Producer Price Index increased by 0.5% for the month and reported an annual increase of 2.5%.

In the Dow Jones Industrial Average, the following stocks led losses:

In the broad market, financial and consumer discretionary stocks led losses.
Technology stocks were also lower with the S&P 500 technology sector down -0.13%.
In small-caps, the Russell 2000 Index closed at 1390.20 for a loss of -9.39 points or -0.67%.
The S&P 600 Small-Cap Index closed at 845.02 for a loss of -6.29 points or -0.74%.
The Dow Jones Small-Cap Growth TSM Index closed at 8397.50 for a loss of -43.39 points or -0.51%.
The Dow Jones Small-Cap Value TSM Index closed at 9501.82 for a loss of -72.40 points or -0.76%.

Other notable index closes included the S&P 400 Mid-Cap Index at 1727.54 for a loss of -11.02 points or -0.63%; the S&P 100 Index at 1057.24 for a loss of -1.86 points or -0.18%; the Russell 3000 Index at 1418.49 for a loss of -3.97 points or -0.28%; the Russell 1000 Index at 1326.93 for a loss of -3.29 points or -0.25%; and the Dow Jones U.S.
Select Dividend Index at 650.97 for a loss of -4.52 points or -0.69%.
